name: Global airline traffic and capacity (ICAO, 2020)
title: Global airline traffic and capacity (ICAO, 2020)
description:
Global airline traffic and capacity data is sourced from 'Airlines for America': https://www.airlines.org/dataset/world-airlines-traffic-and-capacity

The source notes that:
"Traffic and operations data below reflects the systemwide scheduled activity of passenger and cargo airlines operating worldwide, as recorded by ICAO; domestic operations within the former USSR are excluded prior to 1970."

sources.name: International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) via Airlines for America
sources.additionalInfo:
Global airline traffic and capacity data is sourced from 'Airlines for America': https://www.airlines.org/dataset/world-airlines-traffic-and-capacity

The source notes that:
"Traffic and operations data below reflects the systemwide scheduled activity of passenger and cargo airlines operating worldwide, as recorded by ICAO; domestic operations within the former USSR are excluded prior to 1970."

fields.name: Available seat kilometers; ASKs
fields.description: In the airline industry available kilometers is a measure of passenger carrying capacity. It is equal to the number of seats available multiplied by the number of kilometers flown. An available seat km is the fundamental unit of production for a passenger-carrying airline.

fields.name: Cargo revenue tonne kilometres; RTKs
fields.description:
The number of revenue tonnes of cargo (freight and mail) carried multiplied by the
distance flown.

fields.name: Freight revenue tonne kilometres; RTKs
fields.description: The number of revenue tonnes of freight carried multiplied by the distance flown.

fields.name: Freight tonnes
fields.description: The number of revenue tonnes of freight transported by air.

fields.name: Mail revenue tonne kilometers; RTKs
fields.description: The number of revenue tonnes of mail carried multiplied by the distance flown.

fields.name: Passenger load factor (passengers / available seats)
fields.description: The passenger load factor (PLF) measures the ratio of actual passengers to the available seats. It effectively measures the percentage of available seats that are taken by actual passengers.

fields.name: Revenue passenger kilometers
fields.description: The number of revenue passengers carried multiplied by the distance flown.
